sentence.Network_en: A series of movies will be shown to commemorate the 30th anniversary of his death.
sentence.Network_cn: 为纪念他逝世30周年，有一系列的电影要上映。

sentence.Network_en: This building was built to commemorate the Fire of London.
sentence.Network_cn: 这栋大楼是为纪念“伦敦大火”而兴建的.

sentence.Network_en: A special version of "Casablanca" is being released on video to commemorate the film's 50th birthday.
sentence.Network_cn: 为纪念该片上映50周年，准备发行《北非谍影》的特别版录像带。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: from Latin commemorat- 'brought to remembrance', from the verb commemorare, from com- 'altogether' + memorare 'relate' (from memor 'mindful')

entry.def: To commemorate an important event or person means to remember them by means of a special action, ceremony, or specially created object.

example.ex: One room contained a gallery of paintings commemorating great moments in baseball history...
example.tran: 有一个房间里陈列着很多纪念棒球史上伟大时刻的画作。

example.ex: The 200th anniversary of Mozart's death is being commemorated around the world with concerts featuring his work.
example.tran: 世界各地将举办以莫扎特的作品为主题的音乐会，以纪念他逝世200周年。

means.word_mean: 1. mark by some ceremony or observation;

sentences.sentence: "We marked the anniversary of his death"

means.word_mean: 2. call to remembrance; keep alive the memory of someone or something, as in a ceremony;

sentences.sentence: "We remembered the 50th anniversary of the liberation of Auschwitz"
"Remember the dead of the First World War"

means.word_mean: 3. be or provide a memorial to a person or an event;

sentences.sentence: "This sculpture commemorates the victims of the concentration camps"

stems_affixes.word_buile: com共同+memor记忆+able……的→大家该一起记住→值得纪念的
im不+memor记忆+ial……的→不能记得的→远古的
memor记忆+andum东西→帮助记的东西→备忘录

stems_affixes.value_cn: 记忆,记忆力;回忆;存储[器]
stems_affixes.word_buile: memor记忆+y状态,性质→n.记忆,记忆力;回忆;存储[器]
re再+membr=memor记忆+ance表名词→n.记得,记忆
com共同+memor记住+ate表动词→大家一起记住→纪念

stems_affixes.value_cn: 记住;[to]转达问候,代……致意,代……问好
